metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Very often, in programming, you will need a data type that can only have one of two values, like:
content.html: Very often, in programming, you will need a data type that can only have one of two values, like:

content.text: For this, C++ has a bool data type, which can take the values true (1) or false (0).
content.html: For this, C++ has a bool data type, which can take the values true (1) or false (0).

content.text: A boolean variable is declared with the bool keyword and can take the values true or false :
content.html: A boolean variable is declared with the bool keyword and can take the values true or false:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
bool isCodingFun = true;bool isFishTasty = false;cout << isCodingFun;  
  // Outputs 1 (true)cout << isFishTasty;  // Outputs 0 (false)

content.code:
bool isCodingFun = true;bool isFishTasty = false;cout << isCodingFun;
// Outputs 1 (true)cout << isFishTasty;  // Outputs 0 (false)

syntax_highlighting.text:
bool isCodingFun = true;bool isFishTasty = false;cout << isCodingFun;  
 // Outputs 1 (true)cout << isFishTasty;  // Outputs 0 (false)

content.code_html:
bool isCodingFun = true;
bool isFishTasty = false;
cout << isCodingFun;  // Outputs 1 (true)
cout << isFishTasty;  // Outputs 0 (false)

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
bool isCodingFun = true;bool isFishTasty = false;cout << isCodingFun;  
  // Outputs 1 (true)cout << isFishTasty;  // Outputs 0 (false)

content.text: From the example above, you can read that a true value returns 1 , and false returns 0 .
content.html: From the example above, you can read that a true value returns 1, and false returns 0.

content.text: However, it is more common to return a boolean value by comparing values and variables (see next page).
content.html: However, it is more common to return a boolean value by comparing values and variables (see next page).

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What will be the output of the following code? bool isSunny = false; cout << isSunny;
content.html:
What will be the output of the following code?
bool isSunny = false;
cout << isSunny;
